lead_paragraph: A man accused of planning a massacre at this year’s Super Bowl was convicted Wednesday of federal charges. Kurt Havelock faced six counts of mailing threatening communications in United States District Court in Phoenix. According to court records, Havelock bought an AR-15 semiautomatic rifle and 200 rounds of ammunition from the Scottsdale Gun Club on Jan. 30 to kill people at the Super Bowl in Glendale. However, Havelock had a change of heart. He called his parents, and they persuaded him to turn himself in to the Tempe police.
